definition:
An $M$ is called *irreducible* if for each embedding of a standard
$(n-1)$-sphere $S^{n-1}$ in $M$, there is an embedding of a $D^n$ in $M$
such that the image of the boundary $\partial D^n$ coincides with the
image of $S^{n-1}$.

In case of dimension three it can be proved that each irreducible
3-manifold is also a 3-manifold.
